original: Dīgha Nikāya 12
analyzed: dīgha nikāya
translated: The Long Discourses of the Buddha 12🔽

original: Lohiccasutta
analyzed: lohiccasutta
translated: Long Discourses with Lohicca

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi yena sālavatikā tadavasari.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi yena sālavatikā tat avasari
translated: Once the Buddha was traveling through the Kosalan country with a large Saṅgha of five hundred monks. He arrived at a town called Sālavatikā.

original: Tena kho pana samayena lohicco brāhmaṇo sālavatikaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sālavatikam ajjhāvasati sattussadam sa tiṇa kaṭṭhodakam sa dhaññam rāja bhoggam raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnam rāja dāyam brahmadeyya
translated: At that time the brahmin Lohicca was living in Sālavatikā. It was a town full of grass, timber, water, and grain, a town rich in food, given to him by King Pasenadi of Kosala as a royal gift and grant.

original: Tena kho pana samayena lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa evarūpaṁ pāpakaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ hoti:
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa evarūpam pāpakam diṭṭhigatam uppannam hoti
translated: At that time the brahmin Lohicca had this pernicious view:

original: “idha samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigaccheyya, kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya, kiñhi paro parassa karissati.
analyzed: idha samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā kusalam dhammaṃ adhigaccheyya kusalam dhammam adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya kiñhi paraḥ parassa karissati
translated: “There is no other world, there are no spontaneously born beings, there is no fruit or result of good or bad deeds.”

original: Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma purāṇam bandhanam chinditvā aññam navam bandhanam kareyya
translated: It was just as if a man were to cut a reed off at the top, thinking:🔽“Let the top of the reed grow no more.”

original: evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi, kiñhi paro parassa karissatī”ti.
analyzed: evam sampadam idam pāpakam lobha dhammam vadāmi kim hi paraḥ parassa karissati iti
translated: I say that this is how it is with this evil greed. What can one person do for another?”

original: Assosi kho lohicco brāhmaṇo:
analyzed: assosi kho lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: The brahmin Lohicca heard this

original: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sālavatikaṁ anuppatto.
analyzed: samaṇaḥ khalu bho gotamaḥ sakya putto sakya kulā pabbajitaḥ kosalesu cārikam caramānaḥ mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena saddhim pañcamattehi bhikkhu satehi sālavatikam anuppattaḥ
translated: “The recluse Gotama, the son of the Sakyans who went forth from a Sakyan clan, has been wandering in the Kosalan country with a large Sangha of bhikkhus, with five hundred bhikkhus.

original: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:🔽‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’.
analyzed: tam kha pana bhavantam gotamam evam kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggataḥ  iti pi saḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ vijjā caraṇa sampanno sugataḥ loka vidū anuttaraḥ purisa damma sārathi satthā deva manussānam buddhaḥ bhagavā
translated: Now a good report of Master Gotama has been spread to this effect:🔽‘That Blessed One is accomplished, fully enlightened, perfect in true knowledge and conduct, sublime, knower of worlds, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed, teacher of gods and humans, enlightened, blessed.’

original: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
analyzed: saḥ imam lokam sa devakam sa mārakam sa brahmakam sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇim pajam sa deva manussam sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti
translated: He has himself realized this world—with its gods, its Maras, and its Brahmas, this generation, with its contemplatives and brahmins, its gods and humans—and he makes it known to others.

original: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
analyzed: saḥ dhammam deseti ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāseti
translated: He teaches the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing; he reveals a holy life that’s utterly perfect and pure.

original: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu kho pana tathārūpānam arahatam dassanam hoti iti
translated: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

original: Atha kho lohicco brāhmaṇo rosikaṁ nhāpitaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ rosikam nhāpitam āmantesi
translated: Then Lohicca addressed the barber Rosika,

original: “ehi tvaṁ, samma rosike, yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ puccha:🔽‘lohicco, bho gotama, brāhmaṇo bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchatī’ti;
analyzed: ehi tva samma rosike yena samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena samaṇam gotamam appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram puccha  lohiccaḥ bho gotama brāhmaṇaḥ bhavantam gotamam appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati iti
translated: “Come, Rosika, go to the ascetic Gotama and ask in my name whether the ascetic Gotama is healthy, strong, and living comfortably,

original: evañca vadehi—
analyzed: evañca vadehi
translated: and then say:

original: adhivāsetu kira bhavaṁ gotamo lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhavam gotamaḥ lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: ‘Lohicca the brahmin invites the ascetic Gotama to a meal tomorrow, together with the Sangha of monks.’”🔽“Yes, sir,” Rosika replied.

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho rosikā nhāpito lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami;
analyzed: eva bhoti kho rosikā nhāpitaḥ lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami
translated: “Yes, sir,” he replied. He then went to the Buddha,

original: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho rosikā
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho rosikā
translated: bowed, sat down,

original: nhāpito bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: nhāpitaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said,

original: “lohicco, bhante, brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati;
analyzed: lohiccaḥ bhante brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati
translated: “Sir, Lohicca asks if you are healthy, strong, and living comfortably;

original: evañca vadeti—
analyzed: evañca vada iti
translated: and he says this:

original: adhivāsetu kira, bhante, bhagavā lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhante bhagavā lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: Please accept tomorrow’s meal from him together with the Sangha of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.🔽Atha kho rosikā nhāpito bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena  atha khalu rosikā nhāpitaḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā
translated: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.🔽The barber then got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him,

original: padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena lohicco brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā lohiccaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: padakkhiṇam katvā yena lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā lohiccam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: and went to Lohicca. He told him what had happened,

original: “avocumhā kho mayaṁ bhoto vacanena taṁ bhagavantaṁ:🔽‘lohicco, bhante, brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati;
analyzed: avocumha khalu mayam bhotaḥ vacanena tam bhagavanta  lohiccaḥ bhante brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati
translated: “We did tell him.

original: evañca vadeti—
analyzed: evañca vada iti
translated: He asked us to tell you that he is well and healthy, and that he is living comfortably,

original: adhivāsetu kira, bhante, bhagavā lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā’ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhante bhagavā lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: and to invite you to a meal tomorrow, together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Adhivutthañca pana tena bhagavatā”ti.
analyzed: adhivuttham ca pana tena bhagavatā ati
translated: The Buddha has accepted.”

original: Atha kho lohicco brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā rosikaṁ nhāpitaṁ āmantesi:🔽“ehi tvaṁ, samma rosike, yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā samaṇassa gotamassa kālaṁ ārocehi—
analyzed: atha kho lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena sake nivesane paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā rosikam nhāpitam āmantesi  ehi tva samma rosike yena samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā samaṇassa gotamassa kālam ārocehi
translated: The next morning Lohicca had various kinds of fine food prepared. He then told his barber Rosika,

original: kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: kālaḥ bho gotama niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: “Go to the Buddha and tell him that the meal is ready.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho rosikā nhāpito lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho rosikā nhāpitaḥ lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: “Yes, sir,” Rosika replied. He went to the Buddha, bowed, and stood there.

original: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho rosikā nhāpito bhagavato kālaṁ ārocesi:
analyzed: ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho rosikā nhāpitaḥ bhagavataḥ kālam ārocesi
translated: He announced the time,

original: “kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: kālaḥ bhante niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: “Venerable Sir, it’s time. The meal is ready.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena sālavatikā tenupasaṅkami.🔽Tena kho pana samayena rosikā nhāpito bhagavantaṁ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena yena sālavatikā tena upasaṅkami  tena kho pana samayena rosikā nhāpitaḥ bhagavantam piṭṭhitaḥ piṭṭhitaḥ anubandhaḥ hoti
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Sālavatikā together with the Sangha of monks.🔽Rosika followed behind the Buddha.

original: Atha kho rosikā nhāpito bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu rosikā nhāpitaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He said to the Buddha,

original: “lohiccassa, bhante, brāhmaṇassa evarūpaṁ pāpakaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ:
analyzed: lohiccassa bhante brāhmaṇassa evarūpam pāpakam diṭṭhigatam uppanna
translated: “Sir, the brahmin Lohicca has this bad view:

original: ‘idha samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigaccheyya, kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya—
analyzed: idha samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā kusalam dhammaṃ adhigaccheyya kusalam dhammam adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya
translated: ‘There is no other world, there are no spontaneously reborn beings, there is no fruit or result of good or bad deeds.’

original: kiñhi paro parassa karissati.
analyzed: kim hi paraḥ parassa karissati
translated: What can one person do for another?

original: Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma purāṇam bandhanam chinditvā aññam navam bandhanam kareyya
translated: It’s just like cutting down an old tree and then chopping up the stump.

original: evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi—
analyzed: evam sampadam idam pāpakam lobha dhammam vadāmi
translated: This is how I understand the Buddha’s teaching,

original: kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’ti.
analyzed: kim hi paraḥ parassa karissati iti
translated: for what can one person do for another?”

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā lohiccaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetū”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā lohiccam brāhmaṇam etasmai pāpakāḥ diṭṭhi gatāḥ vivecetu uti
translated: “It would be good, Sir, if the Buddha would instruct the brahmin Lohicca in the Dhamma.

original: “Appeva nāma siyā, rosike, appeva nāma siyā, rosike”ti.
analyzed: appā iva nāma siyā rosike appā iva nāma siyā rosikā iti
translated: “Perhaps it will be so, Rosika, perhaps it will be so.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā yena lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā yena lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: Then the Buddha went to the brahmin Lohicca’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Atha kho lohicco brāhmaṇo buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
analyzed: atha kho lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi
translated: Lohicca personally served various kinds of fine food to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: 1. Lohiccabrāhmaṇānuyoga
analyzed: lohicca brāhmaṇa anuyoga
translated: The Instruction to Lohicca

original: Atha kho lohicco brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: When the Buddha had finished his meal, Lohicca took a low seat and sat down to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho lohiccaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam khalu lohiccam brāhmaṇam bhagavān etat avoca
translated: and the Blessed One said to him:

original: “saccaṁ kira te, lohicca, evarūpaṁ pāpakaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ:
analyzed: saccam kira te lohicca evarūpam pāpakam diṭṭhi gatam uppanna
translated: “Lohicca, is it true that such a pernicious view has arisen in you?”

original: ‘idha samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigaccheyya, kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya, kiñhi paro parassa karissati.
analyzed: idha samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā kusalam dhammaṃ adhigaccheyya kusalam dhammam adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya kiñhi paraḥ parassa karissati
translated: “It’s true, Master Gotama.”

original: Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma purāṇam bandhanam chinditvā aññam navam bandhanam kareyya
translated: “Lohicca, it’s just as if someone were to take a loan and then say, ‘I’m not paying back the loan I took out.🔽You can take it back and I won’t pay you back.’

original: evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi, kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’”ti?
analyzed: evam sampadam idam pāpakam lobha dhammam vadāmi kim hi paraḥ parassa karissati iti
translated: And then he would take out another loan.🔽This is how I understand the Dhamma taught by Master Gotama.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: eva bho gotama
translated: “Yes, sir.”

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, lohicca,
analyzed: tam kim maññasi lohit ca
translated: “What do you think, Lohicca?

original: nanu tvaṁ sālavatikaṁ ajjhāvasasī”ti?
analyzed: nanu tvam sālavatikam ajjhāvasasi iti
translated: Don’t you live in Sālavatikā?”

original: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
analyzed: eva bho gotama
translated: “Yes, sir.”

original: “Yo nu kho, lohicca, evaṁ vadeyya:
analyzed: yaḥ nu khalu lohiccaḥ evam vadeyya
translated: “Lohicca, suppose someone were to say,

original: ‘lohicco brāhmaṇo sālavatikaṁ ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sālavatikam ajjhāvasati
translated: ‘Lohicca the brahmin lives in Sālavatikā.

original: Yā sālavatikāya samudayasañjāti lohiccova taṁ brāhmaṇo ekako paribhuñjeyya, na aññesaṁ dadeyyā’ti.
analyzed: yā sālavatikāya samudaya sañjāti lohiccaḥ uva tam brāhmaṇaḥ ekakaḥ paribhuñjeyya na aññesam dadeyya ati
translated: The brahmin Lohicca would be able to enjoy all the income from Sālavatikā all by himself and would not have to share it with anyone else.”

original: Evaṁ vādī so ye taṁ upajīvanti, tesaṁ antarāyakaro vā hoti, no vā”ti?
analyzed: evam vādī saḥ ye tam upajīvanti tesam antarāya karaḥ vā hoti no vāti
translated: “If he spoke thus, would he be creating an obstacle for those who depend on him for a living?”

original: “Antarāyakaro, bho gotama”.
analyzed: antarāya karaḥ bho gotama
translated: “Yes, Master Gotama.”

original: “Antarāyakaro samāno hitānukampī vā tesaṁ hoti ahitānukampī vā”ti?
analyzed: antarāya karaḥ samānaḥ hita anukampī vā tesam hoti ahita anukampī vā ati
translated: “If he creates an obstacle for them, is he then one who has compassion and sympathy for them, or is he one who has no compassion or sympathy for them?”

original: “Ahitānukampī, bho gotama”.
analyzed: ahita anukampī bho gotama
translated: “He is one who has no compassion or sympathy for them, Master Gotama.”

original: “Ahitānukampissa mettaṁ vā tesu cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ hoti sapattakaṁ vā”ti?
analyzed: ahita anukampissa mettam vā tesu cittam paccupaṭṭhitam hoti sa pattakam vā ati
translated: “If he has no compassion or sympathy for them, is his mind set on their welfare or on their harm?”

original: “Sapattakaṁ, bho gotama”.

analyzed: ayam kho lohit ca dutiyaḥ satthā yaḥ loke codanā rahaḥ
translated: This is the second teacher who is worthy of reproof.

original: yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjā.
analyzed: yaḥ ca pana evarūpam satthāram codeti sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjā
translated: And if anyone criticizes such a teacher, that criticism is false, wrong, unrighteous, and blameworthy.

original: Puna caparaṁ, lohicca, idhekacco satthā yassatthāya agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, svāssa sāmaññattho anuppatto hoti.
analyzed: puna capara lohicca idha ekaccaḥ satthā yassa atthāya agārasmaḥ anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ hoti su āssa sāmaññattho anuppatto hoti
translated: “Again, there is the case where a certain teacher has attained the true goal of the holy life for which sons of good family rightly go forth from home into homelessness.

original: So taṁ sāmaññatthaṁ anupāpuṇitvā sāvakānaṁ dhammaṁ deseti:
analyzed: saḥ tam sāmaññattham anupāpuṇitvā sāvakānam dhammam deseti
translated: Having attained the true goal of the holy life for which sons of good family rightly go forth from home into homelessness, he teaches his disciples the Dhamma:

original: ‘idaṁ vo hitāya, idaṁ vo sukhāyā’ti.
analyzed: idam vaḥ hitāya idam vaḥ sukhāya ati
translated: ‘This is for your welfare. This is for your happiness.’

original: Tassa sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṁ odahanti, na aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.
analyzed: tassa sāvakā na sussūsanti na sotam odahanti na aññā cittam upaṭṭhapenti vokkamma ca satthu sāsanā vattanti
translated: His disciples don’t want to listen, don’t lend ear, or apply their minds to understand. They go against the teacher’s message, don’t side with him.

original: So evamassa codetabbo:
analyzed: saḥ evam assa codetabbaḥ
translated: He should be criticized in this way:

original: ‘āyasmā kho yassatthāya agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito, so te sāmaññattho anuppatto.
analyzed: āyasman kho yassatthāya agārasman anagāriyam pabbajito so te sāmañña tthaḥ an uppatto
translated: ‘The venerable one has attained the true goal of the holy life for which sons of good family rightly go forth from home into homelessness.

original: Taṁ tvaṁ sāmaññatthaṁ anupāpuṇitvā sāvakānaṁ dhammaṁ desesi:
analyzed: tam tvam sāmañña attham an upāpuṇitvā sāvakānam dhammam desesi
translated: Having attained the true goal of the holy life for which sons of good family rightly go forth from home into homelessness, he teaches his disciples the Dhamma:

original: “idaṁ vo hitāya, idaṁ vo sukhāyā”ti.
analyzed: idam vaḥ hitāya idam vaḥ sukhāya ati
translated: “This is for your welfare. This is for your happiness.”

original: Tassa te sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṁ odahanti, na aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.
analyzed: tassa te sāvakā na sussūsanti na sotam odahanti na aññā cittam upaṭṭhapenti vokkamma ca satthu sāsanā vattanti
translated: His disciples do not want to listen to him, do not lend an ear, and do not apply their minds to attain knowledge. They act contrary to the Teacher’s instructions.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api nāma purāṇam bandhanam chinditvā aññam navam bandhanam kareyya
translated: It is just as if someone were to cut down an old tree and then nurture the stump,

original: evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi, kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’ti.
analyzed: evam sampadam idam pāpakam lobha dhammam vadāmi kim hi paraḥ parassa karissati iti
translated: so too, I say, is this evil practice of greed. What can one person do for another?”

original: Ayaṁ kho, lohicca, tatiyo satthā, yo loke codanāraho;
analyzed: ayam kho lohit ca tatiyaḥ satthā yaḥ loke codanā rahaḥ
translated: “This, Lohicca, is the third teacher in the world who deserves criticism.

original: yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjā.
analyzed: yaḥ ca pana evarūpam satthāram codeti sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjā
translated: And if anyone criticizes such a teacher, his criticism is factual, true, genuine, in accordance with the Dhamma, and blameless.

original: Ime kho, lohicca, tayo satthāro, ye loke codanārahā,
analyzed: ime kho lohit ca tayo satthāraḥ ye loke codanā rahā
translated: “These, Lohicca, are the three teachers in the world who deserve criticism.

original: yo ca panevarūpe satthāro codeti, sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjā”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ ca pana evarūpe satthāro codeti sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjāti
translated: And if anyone criticizes such teachers, his criticism is factual, true, genuine, in accordance with the Dhamma, and blameless.”

original: 3. Nacodanārahasatthu
analyzed: na codana raha satthu
translated: A Teacher Who Does Not Deserve Criticism

original: Evaṁ vutte, lohicco brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte lohiccaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Lohicca said to the Blessed One:

original: “atthi pana, bho gotama, koci satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho”ti?
analyzed: atthi pana bho gotama koci satthā yaḥ loke na codanā rahā iti
translated: “But, Master Gotama, is there any teacher in the world who does not deserve criticism?”

original: “Atthi kho, lohicca, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho”ti.
analyzed: atthi kho lohicca satthā yaḥ loke na codanā rahā ti
translated: “There is, Lohicca.”

original: “Katamo pana so, bho gotama, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho”ti?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana saḥ bho gotama satthā yaḥ loke na codanā raho ti
translated: “But, Master Gotama, who is that teacher?”

original: “Idha, lohicca, tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṁ, sammāsambuddho …pe…
analyzed: idha lohicca tathāgataḥ loke uppajjati araha sammāsambuddhaḥ pe
translated: “Here, Lohicca, a Tathagata appears in the world, accomplished, fully enlightened …

analyzed: evam kho lohicca bhikkhu sīla sampannaḥ hoti pe  paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: This is how a bhikkhu is perfected in morality.

original: yasmiṁ kho, lohicca, satthari sāvako evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ visesaṁ adhigacchati, ayampi kho, lohicca, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho.
analyzed: yasmin kho lohit ca satthari sāvakaḥ evarūpam uḷāram visesam adhigacchati ayam pi kho lohit ca satthā yaḥ loke na codanā rahaḥ
translated: He dwells suffusing one quarter with a mind filled with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth; so above, below, around, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he dwells suffusing the entire world with a mind filled with loving-kindness, abundant, exalted, immeasurable, without hostility and without ill will.🔽This is how a bhikkhu is perfected in concentration.

original: Yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā codanā abhūtā atacchā adhammikā sāvajjā.🔽…pe…🔽Dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ ca pana evarūpam satthāram codeti sā codanā abhūtā atacchā adhammikā sāvajjā  pe  dutiyam jhānam
translated: This is how a bhikkhu is perfected in wisdom.🔽This is how a bhikkhu is perfected in liberation.

analyzed: tatiyam jhānam
translated: This is how a bhikkhu is perfected in the knowledge and vision of liberation.

original: catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: This is how a bhikkhu is perfected in the destruction of the taints.

original: Yasmiṁ kho, lohicca, satthari sāvako evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ visesaṁ adhigacchati, ayampi
analyzed: yasmin kho lohicca satthari sāvakaḥ evarūpam uḷāram visesam adhigacchati ayam pi

original: kho, lohicca, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho, yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā
analyzed: kho lohit ca satthā yaḥ loke na codanā rahaḥ yaḥ ca pana evarūpam satthāram codeti sā

analyzed: na aparam itthattāya ati pajānāti  yasmin kho lohicca satthari sāvakaḥ evarūpam uḷāram visesam adhigacchati ayam pi

translated: When this was said, Lohicca said to the Buddha,

analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama purisaḥ purisam naraka papātam patantam kesesu gahetvā uddharitvā thale patiṭṭhapeyya

analyzed: evam eva aham bhotā gotamena naraka papātam papatantaḥ uddharitvā thale patiṭṭhāpito

original: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent!🔽Just as a man might set upright what has been overturned,

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: or reveal what is hidden, or show the way to one who is lost,

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti

translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Dhamma and to the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”
